Description for the JASP files: The number of additional hours that each of ten patients slept after having been administered two 'soporific drugs' (i.e., sleeping pills).
Responses of 2571 students on an SPSS Anxiety Questionnaire.
Weight of 16 participants before and after an eight-week period of excessive calorie intake.
The number of disruptive behaviors by dementia patients during two different phases of the lunar cycle.
Reading performance of two groups of pupils - one control group and one group that was given Directed Reading Activities.
The time it took two groups of participants to see the objects hidden in a stereogram - one group received advance information about the scene, the other group did not.

Origin: Data reported in Wagenmakers et al. (2015).
Description for the JASP files: Openness to Experience scores for two groups of students - while filling out the personality questionnaire, both groups rotated a kitchen roll with their hands (one group clockwise, the other group counterclockwise).

Origin: Subset of the data reported in Matzke et al. (2015).
Description for the JASP files: The number of correctly recalled words by two groups of participants - during the retention interval, one group was instructed to fixate on a centrally presented dot; the other group was instructed to execute horizontal saccades.
The number of mischievous acts committed by two groups of people, those with and those without an invisibility cloak.
Pain threshold for people with different hair color.
Preference ratings for Facebook profiles - five groups judge the same profiles, except for the aspect that was manipulated: the number of friends for that profile.
Post-advertisement attitudes towards a brand expressed by four different groups - each group saw the same advertisement except for the aspect that was manipulated: the eye-color of the model.

Origin: Subset of the data reported in Balzarini et al. (2016).
Description for the JASP files: Men and women's feelings towards their partners after watching either erotic or artistic pictures.
Heart rate of male and female runners and generally sedentary participants following 6 minutes of exercise.
Median attractiveness ratings of 50 attractive or unattractive faces after consuming different amounts of alcohol.

"Heights in inches of the singers in the New York Choral Society in 1979. The data are grouped according to voice part. The vocal range for each voice part increases in pitch according to the following order: Bass 2, Bass 1, Tenor 2, Tenor 1, Alto 2, Alto 1, Soprano 2, Soprano 1."

"The response is the length of odontoblasts (cells responsible for tooth growth) in 60 guinea pigs. Each animal received one of three dose levels of vitamin C (0.5, 1, and 2 mg/day) by one of two delivery methods, orange juice or ascorbic acid (a form of vitamin C and coded as VC)."
The number of seconds before celebrities retch while eating disgusting food - each celebrity consumed four different kinds of disgusting items.
Attitudes towards water, wine, and beer after watching positive, neutral, or negative imagery of that drink - each participant features in each cell of the 3x3 design.

Origin: Subset of the data reported in Ryan, Wilde, & Crist (2013).
Description for the JASP files: The extent to which people want to kill arthropods that vary in freighteningness (low, high) and disgustingness (low, high) - each participant rates their attitude for all arthropods.
column10: (bug in analyses type? cannot convert likert to ordinal)

Description for the JASP files: Preference scores of ten men and ten women for nine speed-dating partners who varied in attractiveness (high, average, low) and charisma (high, some, none).
Men's libido (and that of their partners) after having been administered different doses of Viagra.
A set of normative ratings for 5,553 English words on nine psycholinguistic dimensions.
Questionnaire of students prior to an exam (variables are anxiety, preparedness, and grade).
Creativity test scores and ranking in a lying competition.

Origin: Data reported in Dolan et al. (2009).
Description for the JASP files: Scores on Big Five personality traits of 500 participants.

Origin: Data collected from Rotten Tomatoes in 2015 by E.J. Wagenmakers.
Description for the JASP files: Rotten Tomatoes ratings and box office success for movies featuring Adam Sandler.
Fat gain of participants and their non-deliberate exercise activities.
Participants' Body Mass Index and average daily number of steps.
High school grades, SAT scores, and Grade Point Average of 224 university students.
Factors that may influence album sales.
The selling price and age of antique clocks, and the number of bidders in the auction.
Age, cabin class, and survival status of 1313 passengers on the Titanic.
Answers of 12 zombies to the question: "what is your appetitive state?"

Origin: Data set reconstructed from the summary information in Rosa et al. (1998).
Description for the JASP files: Correct and incorrect decisions from therapeutic touch practitioners in Emily Rosa's famous experiment. "In the initial trial, the subjects stated the correct location of the investigator's hand in 70 (47%) of 150 tries."

Origin: Fictional data from Moore, McCaib, & Craig (2012).
Description for the JASP files: Responses of 20 participants to the question: "Which of these two sun block lotions is better?"
The number of times that each of two experimental coins landed on its edge (out of 1,000 tosses).

Origin: Subset of the data reported in Uhleman et al. (1974) provided by Haberman (1978).
Description for the JASP files: The number of reported life stresses (summed across participants) that occurred in specific months prior to an interview.
Response rate from MOOC lecturers to questions posed by eight constructed identities [i.e., gender (male, female) x race (White, Indian, Black, Chinese)].
Physical activity and consumption of fruits of 1184 students.
The number of cats who learned to dance, trained by one of two types of conditioning.

Origin: Data set reconstructed from the summary information by MacAlister (1881) and reported in Jamil et al. (2017).
Description for the JASP files: Recovery status of patients treated with either Lister's method or ordinary dressings.
The number of cats and dogs who learned to dance, trained by one of two types of conditioning.
Court decisions on a death penalty (i.e., yes or no) split by race of a defendant (i.e., White or Black) and the race of the victim (i.e., White or Black).
Charles Spearman's data of pupils' school grades and sensory discrimination scores.

Analysis: Fixed effects, Meta regression & Random effects
Description for the JASP files: Test statistics from studies examining the effectiveness of a BCG vaccine.
Responses from 2,800 participants on 25 Big Five Inventory items.
Indicators of industralization in 1960, and political democracy in 1960 and 1965.
A classic example of the need to visualize one's data.

Origin: Subset of the data reported in Stulp et al. (2015).
Description for the JASP files: Heights of US presidents and their proportion of the popular vote.
Synthetic data with missing values.

Chapter: Field - Discovering Statistics using IBM SPSS Statistics
Description for the JASP files: This folder contains the data sets from Field, A. P. (2017). Discovering Statistics Using IBM SPSS Statistics (5th ed.). London: Sage. These data sets were constructed by Andy Field who therefore owns the copyright. Andy Field generously agreed that we can include these data sets in the JASP data library. These data sets are also publicly available on the website that accompanies Andy Field's book: https://edge.sagepub.com/field5e. Without Andy Field's explicit consent, these data sets may not be distributed for commercial purposes, these data sets may not be edited, and these data sets may not be presented without acknowledging their source (i.e., the terms of a CC BY-NC-ND license; https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-nd/3.0/).

Part: Introduction to the Practice of Statistics (Moore, McCabe and Craig, 2012)
Chapter: Moore, McCabe, & Craig - Introduction to the Practice of Statistics
Description for the JASP files: This folder contains the data sets from Moore, D. S., McCabe, G. P., & Craig, B. A. (2012). Introduction to the Practice of Statistics (7th ed.). New York: W. H. Freeman and Company. Moore, McCabe, and Craig generously agreed that we can include the data sets in the JASP data library. These data sets are also publicly available on the website that accompanies their book: whfreeman.com/ips7e. Without the authors' explicit consent, these data sets may not be distributed for commercial purposes, these data sets may not be edited, and these data sets may not be presented without acknowledging their source (i.e., the terms of a CC BY-NC-ND license; https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-nd/3.0/).
